title: Assignment
markdown:
# Assignment (=)

 The **assignment (`=`)** operator is used to assign a value to a variable. The assignment operation evaluates to the assigned value. Chaining the assignment operator is possible in order to assign a single value to multiple variables.

## [Try it](#try%5Fit)

## [Syntax](#syntax)

```
x = y

```

## [Examples](#examples)

### [Simple assignment and chaining](#simple%5Fassignment%5Fand%5Fchaining)

```
let x = 5;
let y = 10;
let z = 25;

x = y; // x is 10
x = y = z; // x, y and z are all 25

```

### [Value of assignment expressions](#value%5Fof%5Fassignment%5Fexpressions)

The assignment expression itself evaluates to the value of the right-hand side, so you can log the value and assign to a variable at the same time.

```
let x;
console.log(x); // undefined
console.log(x = 2); // 2
console.log(x); // 2

```

## [Specifications](#specifications)

| Specification                                                                                                                                                     |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [ECMAScript Language Specification  \# sec-assignment-operators](https://tc39.es/ecma262/multipage/ecmascript-language-expressions.html#sec-assignment-operators) |

## [Browser compatibility](#browser%5Fcompatibility)

BCD tables only load in the browser
